form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Moody introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to recoup certain payments of Federal financial assistance.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Recouping Educational Contributions Linked to Antisemitic Institutional Misconduct Act or the RECLAIM Act.

section.header: Effect on entire program of termination of or refusal to grant or to continue assistance
section.text: Section 602 of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (42 U.S.C. 2000d–1) is amended, in paragraph (1) of the third sentence, by striking shall be limited in its effect to the particular program, or part thereof, in which such noncompliance has been so found, and inserting shall apply to the entire program or activity in which such noncompliance has been so found,.

section.header: Recouping certain payments of Federal financial assistance
section.text: Section 602 of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (42 U.S.C. 2000d–1) is amended, in the third sentence—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and

by inserting after found, the following: (2) by requiring a recipient to repay the amount of any Federal financial assistance provided to the recipient for a program or activity for a fiscal year during which the recipient is found (in accordance with the procedures described in paragraph (1)) to be in such noncompliance concerning the program or activity (without regard to whether the Federal financial assistance has been expended), which shall be collected as a claim of the United States Government in accordance with chapter 37 of title 31, United States Code,.

section.header: Limit on Federal financial assistance after certain injunctions
section.text: Section 603 of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (42 U.S.C. 2000d–2) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking Any and inserting (a) Any; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: If a court issues an injunction in a case, for a claim in which a recipient of Federal financial assistance for a program or activity is alleged to be in violation of this title—

paragraph.text: the Federal department or agency empowered to extend the Federal financial assistance shall not provide any Federal financial assistance to the recipient until the earlier of—

subparagraph.text: the date on which the court certifies that the recipient is in compliance with the injunction; or
the date that is 1 year after the date of issuance of the injunction;

paragraph.text: the Federal department or agency shall notify the other Federal departments and agencies covered by this title of the injunction; and
those Federal departments and agencies shall not provide any Federal financial assistance to the recipient until the earlier of the dates specified in paragraph (1).
